# Read the data
filename = '/kaggle/input/crab-age-prediction/CrabAgePrediction.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(filename)
df.head()
source.39b57c37:
# Get description of the dataset
df.describe()
source.decbd0a8:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(20,15))

def plot_box_subplot(plot_number, variable, nrows, ncols, dataset):
    ax = plt.subplot(nrows, ncols, plot_number)
    ax.boxplot(dataset[variable])
    ax.set_title(variable, fontsize=12)
    pass

variables = list(df.columns)
variables.remove('Age')
variables.remove('Sex')

for i in range(len(variables)):
    plot_box_subplot(i+1, variables[i], 3, 3, df)
plt.suptitle('Box Plots for Numeric variables', fontsize=28)
plt.show()
source.a67ec669:
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(20,15))

def plot_scatter_subplot(plot_number, independent_variable, dependent_variable, nrows,
                         ncols, dataset):
    ax = plt.subplot(nrows, ncols, plot_number)
    ax.scatter(dataset[independent_variable], dataset[dependent_variable])
    ax.set_title(independent_variable, fontsize=12)
    pass

variables = list(df.columns)
variables.remove('Age')
variables.remove('Sex')

for i in range(len(variables)):
    plot_scatter_subplot(i+1, variables[i], 'Age', 3, 3, df)
plt.suptitle('Scatter Plots for Numeric variables', fontsize=28)
plt.show()
source.aefcf2bf:
f_df = df[df["Sex"]=='F'][["Weight", "Age"]]
m_df = df[df["Sex"]=='M'][["Weight", "Age"]]
i_df = df[df["Sex"]=='I'][["Weight", "Age"]]

# Group by Age
f_df = f_df.groupby("Age").count()
m_df = m_df.groupby("Age").count()
i_df = i_df.groupby("Age").count()

# rename columns
f_df.columns = ["Count"]
m_df.columns = ["Count"]
i_df.columns = ["Count"]
source.079247ce:
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = [8, 5]
plt.plot(f_df.index, f_df["Count"], label="Gender: Female")
plt.plot(m_df.index, m_df["Count"], label="Gender: Male")
plt.plot(i_df.index, i_df["Count"], label="Gender: Indeterminate")
plt.xlabel("Age")
plt.ylabel("Frequency")
plt.legend()
plt.show()
source.1943f4f5: ## Section 1: Data Exploration [Index](#index) [Section 1.1: Basic Exploration](#sec11) [Section 1.2: Box Plots](#sec12) [Section 1.3: Scatter Plots](#sec13) [Section 1.4: Section 1.4: Sex versus Age Distribution](#sec14)
source.061adefd: __Comment__: <font color='blue'> Based on box plots, there are outliers in our dataset. Lets look at scatter plots before taking a decision on flooring and capping of variables.
source.a2a98d23: Let's start by exploring the dataset. There are 9 columns in the dataset, and we shall explore each one by one. 'Age' is the dependent variable, and all others are independent variables.
source.ceb14e37: __Comments__:<font color='blue'>Till the age of 5-6 months, most of the Crab's sex is determinate, and thereafter they start developing physical attributes which help determine their sex.
source.fe44cc4d: __Comment__: <font color=blue>There are clear outliers in the 'Height' variable. All others though look roughly ok. We shall remove the two observations where height is an outlier from our dataset for model purpose. For all other variables, there is a positive linear relationship between independent variable and 'Age' - dependent variable.
source.8552f17b:
## Conclusion: [Index](#index)

In this code, we explored some basic characteristics of the data, and looked at the box and scatter plots to understand the columns. In next file we shall look into building a simple linear regression model
